body:
Protests were planned for February 5th, 2011 across the West Bank.  Organizers indicated that protests would be held in Nazareth, Bethlehem, Ramallah and Jerusalem, and the Ramallah demonstrations were widely tweeted about.  The demonstrations, in support of the Egyptian demonstrators, called for Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak to step down for power.  Previous demonstrations in front of the Egyptian Embassy in Ramallah were shut down by the Palestinian Authority on January 30th, 2011, drawing criticism from Human Rights Watch.  Commentary has widely suggested that Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas wants to curb protests against Mubarak, who has been an ally of the PA.  Some expected that February 5th's protests would be similarly shut down, but it seemed that most demonstrations were not directly ended by the PA.

Hind Awwad posted regular updates on the protests in Ramallah.  At 2:20 pm local time, Awwad posted about the growing protest:

 600 protesters so far @ Al-Manara protesting for #Egypt and Tunisia #PalEgypt, #PA is not interfering

Regular updates included slogans such as:

 "America bara bara, min masr o min #Ramallah" pro #jan25 rally
 America out, out, from Egypt and from Ramallah!

Shortly thereafter, updates included reports of pro-PA demonstrators:

 demonstration being infiltrated by abbas supporters chanting pro-abbas chants #PalEgypt

The Daily Nuisance reported:

 20 Abbas supporters showed up at demo in #Ramallah. Intimidated anti-Mubarak protesters. Many left. Only abt 3-400 now. #PalEgypt #jan25

And shortly thereafter, reports of plainclothes officers arresting demonstrators began to surface:

 A few abbas supporters in civilian clothes seen arresting 3 demonstrators and dragging them to the near by police station #PalEgypt

Protests in Jerusalem were not widely covered, but the Daily Nuisance reported:

 Small crowd also gathering at Damascus Gate in East Jerusalem in sol w #Egypt. #PalEgypt #jan25 #Israel #Palestine

And UK-based Protest Watch reported that a small crowd gathered in Bethlehem:

 #Protest In Solidarity with Egypt, Fifty Gather in Bethlehem's Nativity Square: Bethlehem – PNN - As Egyp... http://bit.ly/dLLHfV #Egypt

Events for Egyptian solidarity have been posted on Twitter at #PalEgypt.
original_body:
Protests were planned for February 5th, 2011 across the West Bank. Organizers indicated that protests would be held in Nazareth, Bethlehem, Ramallah and Jerusalem, and the Ramallah demonstrations were widely tweeted about. The demonstrations, in support of the Egyptian demonstrators, called for Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak to step down for power. Previous demonstrations in front of the Egyptian Embassy in Ramallah were shut down by the Palestinian Authority on January 30th, 2011, drawing criticism from Human Rights Watch. Commentary has widely suggested that Palestinian Authority President Mahmoud Abbas wants to curb protests against Mubarak, who has been an ally of the PA. Some expected that February 5th's protests would be similarly shut down, but it seemed that most demonstrations were not directly ended by the PA. Hind Awwad posted regular updates on the protests in Ramallah. At 2:20 pm local time, Awwad posted about the growing protest:
600 protesters so far @ Al-Manara protesting for #Egypt and Tunisia #PalEgypt, #PA is not interfering
Regular updates included slogans such as:
"America bara bara, min masr o min #Ramallah" pro #jan25 rally
America out, out, from Egypt and from Ramallah!
Shortly thereafter, updates included reports of pro-PA demonstrators:
demonstration being infiltrated by abbas supporters chanting pro-abbas chants #PalEgypt
The Daily Nuisance reported:
20 Abbas supporters showed up at demo in #Ramallah. Intimidated anti-Mubarak protesters. Many left. Only abt 3-400 now. #PalEgypt #jan25
And shortly thereafter, reports of plainclothes officers arresting demonstrators began to surface:
A few abbas supporters in civilian clothes seen arresting 3 demonstrators and dragging them to the near by police station #PalEgypt
Protests in Jerusalem were not widely covered, but the Daily Nuisance reported:
Small crowd also gathering at Damascus Gate in East Jerusalem in sol w #Egypt. #PalEgypt #jan25 #Israel #Palestine
And UK-based Protest Watch reported that a small crowd gathered in Bethlehem:
#Protest In Solidarity with Egypt, Fifty Gather in Bethlehem's Nativity Square: Bethlehem – PNN - As Egyp... http://bit.ly/dLLHfV #Egypt

title: Palestine: Demonstrations in Solidarity with Egypt

Organizers indicated that protests would be held in Nazareth, Bethlehem, Ramallah and Jerusalem, and the Ramallah demonstrations were widely tweeted about.
The demonstrations, in support of the Egyptian demonstrators, called for Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak to step down for power.
